Question Text: I would rate my health overall as excellent.
I am rarely interfered with by physical discomfort or pain in my normal activities.
I have a lot of physical and mental energy.
I feel mentally sharp, focused, and free from exhaustion.
I would rate my sleep quality as very good.
I feel able to control important things in my life.
I am able to adapt easily and positively when changes occur.
I feel cheerful and in good spirits.
I feel calm and relaxed.
I have enough energy to fully engage in work, family, friends, and hobbies.
I feel that I have adequate companionship.
I feel included and seldom left out among family, friends, or at work.
I can count on my friends and family for reliable support when things go wrong.
I have positive and healthy relationships with my neighbours and colleagues.
My relationships feel reciprocal; I give and receive support equally.
I prefer to share my feelings and emotions deeply with a partner.
I feel secure and confident in my partner's love (if applicable).
I am consistently in control of my daily screen time and digital usage.
My digital habits effectively support and enhance my productivity.
I feel that social media generally enhances my mental health and well-being.
I feel very safe and secure in my neighborhood.
I would describe my neighborhood as clean, quiet, and well-maintained.
I have sufficient access to park/garden/green space near my home.
My transit/commute from home to work/city is comfortable and efficient.
I feel completely safe and comfortable in my home environment.
My home is clean, organized, and well-maintained.
I have enough private and personal space in my home when I need it.
I feel content with my home, it is my sanctuary.
My primary workspace is comfortable, functional, and conducive to focus.
My home, work, and neighborhood spaces actively support my well-being.
I have found a fulfilling career path.
My current work/job is well-aligned with my long-term career goals.
I feel confident pursuing new roles or jobs when it means higher pay and designation.
I actively seek opportunities to learn new skills and information.
I consistently prioritize my tasks effectively and stick to deadlines.
I usually manage to solve problems effectively and get things done.
I am confident I could deal efficiently with unexpected events like loss of income or job.
Setbacks and failures motivate me rather than discourage me.
I speak to myself kindly and patiently when I make a mistake.
I have a very strong ability to prepare for and plan my future.
I never have trouble paying my bills on time.
I rarely feel anxious about my current financial situation.
I feel secure and satisfied with my current income level.
I feel calm and unstressed about any debts I may have.

I could comfortably handle a major unexpected expense like a hospital bill.
I have clearly defined and specific financial goals.
I have a clear and written financial plan for the next 1-5 years.
I regularly and consistently set aside money for long-term savings.
I am actively and effectively securing my financial future.
I feel highly engaged and interested in my daily activities.
I have a clear sense of purpose, goals, and aims in life.
I actively try to lead a purposeful and meaningful life.
I am mindful of my actions and their impact on others and the world.
I am strongly optimistic and positive about my future.
My relationships with others feel genuine and authentic.
I feel genuinely interested in the lives of people around me.
I find it easy to forgive others, not holding grudges and moving on quickly.
I contribute significantly to society through service, donations, or financial help.
I believe my failings are a normal part of the human experience, not unique defects.
I was sworn at, insulted, or humiliated by a parent or adult.
I felt blamed or shamed for normal childhood mistakes by my parents/caregivers.
I lived with a substance abuser or alcoholic.
I had a household member who was depressed, mentally ill, or attempted self harm.
My parents were separated or divorced.
I witnessed my mother/father being physically abused (pushed, grabbed, or slapped) by another adult.
An adult sexually touched or fondled me, or made me touch them.
I felt emotionally neglected by my family.
I was physically hit so hard it left marks or bruises.
My household struggled financially, and we had difficulty making ends meet.
I frequently find myself expressing anger or frustration toward others when my plans are unexpectedly disrupted.
I find my focus and concentration are interrupted by intense physical desires or romantic fantasies.
I frequently notice that my own solutions are usually superior to the ideas proposed by others.
I have a habit of letting tasks or deadlines slip, which sometimes creates problems for the people I work with.
I believe it is occasionally necessary to misrepresent the facts to achieve a required and positive outcome.
I tend to conserve my energy and find it hard to put in effort that goes beyond the basic requirement of a task.
I am motivated primarily by maximizing my material and financial gain, even in collaborative settings.
I tend to feel personally challenged or attacked if my ideas or actions are contested or criticized.
I believe that people or organizations in positions of power are corrupt or primarily self-serving.
I often make decisions or purchases based on an immediate feeling rather than careful planning.
I actively look for opportunities to help others, even when there is no reward or recognition for me.
I strive to make decisions based on objective principles rather than my personal feelings or biases.
I am committed to speaking the truth and presenting my authentic self, even when it is uncomfortable.
I frequently pause during my day to appreciate and give thanks for the good things in my life.
I carefully examine all evidence and sides of an argument before forming an opinion.
I prioritize nurturing close, reciprocal relationships with my friends and family above other pursuits.
I feel a strong desire to learn new things and find myself fascinated by how the world works.
I maintain a positive outlook and believe that my efforts will lead to a better future.
I am willing to stand up for what is right, even when I am afraid or facing opposition.
I enjoy making others laugh and can easily find the lighter side of difficult situations.
I am consistently early or exactly on time for every appointment and deadline.
I often let my workspace or living area become cluttered and disorganized.
I naturally speak loudly and use expressive gestures when I am talking to others.
I frequently turn down social invitations because I need to be alone to recharge my energy.
I make it a daily habit to verbally praise and validate the feelings of the people around me.
I find myself debating minor details or correcting others even when I know it might be annoying.
I vocalize my stress, anxieties, or worst-case scenarios to others on a regular basis.
I constantly seek out new hobbies, intellectual pursuits, or creative activities to try.
I instinctively use the words "we" and "us" rather than "I" when discussing achievements or plans.
I tend to drive fast or take physical risks for the thrill of immediate excitement.
